actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-220, by Mr. Bonior.

Rule provides for consideration of S. 1722 with 30 minutes of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. An amendment striking all after the enacting clause of S. 1722 and inserting in lieu thereof the provisions contained in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution shall be considered as having been adopted. Upon passage of the bill, the motion to insist on the House amendment to S. 1722 and to request a conference with the Senate shall be considered as having been adopted.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 56.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 257 - 163 (Roll no. 279).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (S. 1722) to provide emergency unemployment compensation, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of S. 1722 (emergency unemployment compensation).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (S. 1722) to provide emergency unemployment compensation, and for other purposes.
